alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar; Pickens (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 9:29AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Pickens, Fayette and Lamar Counties through 1030 AM CST... At 928 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Beaverton to Bent Oak, Mississippi. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winfield, Fayette, Vernon, Gordo, Reform, Millport, Carrollton, Berry, Glen Allen, Kennedy, Belk, Gu- Win, Ethelsville, Bankston, Bluff, Ashcraft Corner, Blooming Grove, Cody, Stone Wall and Wayside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
